intro: Pecluma rhachipterygia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and its showy, velvety flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has heart-shaped, dark green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Pecluma rhachipterygia is widely cultivated as a popular ornamental plant due to its beauty and ease of care.
